lead: Recent developments in climate technology and policy highlight the intersection of innovation and environmental responsibility, from electric vehicles to real estate climate risk assessments.

stories.title: Volvo’s EX60 Promises 400-mile Range in a More Competitive EV Climate
stories.summary: Volvo's new electric SUV, the EX60, aims to redefine the electric vehicle market with a promised range of 400 miles. Featuring advanced technology like HugInCore and Nvidia-powered infotainment, this vehicle is positioned to compete effectively in an increasingly crowded EV landscape. The EX60 reflects the automotive industry's shift towards sustainable transportation.

stories.title: Zillow removed climate risk scores. This climate expert is restoring them.
stories.summary: In a controversial move, Zillow removed climate risk scores from its listings, prompting backlash from climate experts. A prominent climate researcher is now working to reinstate these scores to provide potential homebuyers with crucial information regarding climate-related risks. This initiative highlights the importance of transparency in real estate amid growing climate concerns.

stories.title: Berlin’s Cloover secures over $1.2 Billion to build the “Shopify of Energy”
stories.summary: Cloover, a Berlin-based climate fintech, has raised over $1.2 billion to develop a platform aimed at revolutionizing the energy sector. This funding includes significant equity and a substantial debt facility, which will be used to enhance their software and financing solutions for energy transition. Cloover's initiative represents a significant step towards integrating technology with sustainable energy practices.
